intro: Roldana kerberi var. calzadana, commonly known as the Calzadana rockrose, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cistaceae and is characterized by its dense, branched growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant features thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting to its harsh, dry environment. It produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its resilience and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
